condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Finance Agreement :Effectiveness condition, IV, Art. 4.01 | Description :The Additional Conditions ofEffectiveness consist of the following, namely that the Operational Manual has been adopted by the Borrower, through MINEDU. | DueDate :19-May-2014
Finance Agreement :Finance Agreement :SafeguardsSchedule 2, Section I.D.(a) | Description :The Borrower, through MINEDU, shallcarry out the Project in accordance with the IPPF. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Finance Agreement :Withdrawal ConditionsSchedule 2, Section IV.B. | Description :Notwithstanding the provisionsof Part A of this Section, no withdrawal shall be made from the Loan Account until the Bank has received payment in full of theFront-end Fee. | Due Date :31-Dec-2014

Finance Agreement :Independent Verification Agency Schedule 2, Section I.B.3 (a) | Description :The Borrower, through MINEDU, shallno later than three months after restructuring, contract an agent, independent from the Borrower (Independent Verification Agent)w/experience & qualifications in the Ed. Sec. & TORs satisfactory to the Bank for the carrying out of tech. reviews of agreedresults during Project implementation, focused on the compliance of tDLIs w/verification of protocols in OM.

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A.1 | Description :The Borrower, through MINEDU, shall operate & maintain, until the completion of the execution of the Project the UE 118, which shall be responsible for the Project'coordination, supervision, monitoring, evaluation & fiduciary management, and shall, not later than 90 days after the EffectiveDate, employ fiduciary staff in adequate numbers acceptable to the Bank. | Due Date :17-Aug-2014

Finance Agreement :Other Undertakings | Description :The Borrower, through MINEDU, shall ensure, until completion of the Project,that adequate budgetary resources are annually allocated and made available to its units for the achievement of the DLIs. |Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: IRI9. Teacher performance evaluation system designed, implemented and results reported.

target.value: Teacher performance evaluation system is being implemented

title.narrative: IRI10. Evaluation instruments to determine entrance to and promotions within the Teaching Career designed

target.value: Evaluation instruments to determine entrance to and promotions within the Teaching Career designed

actual.value: Evaluation instruments to determine entrance to and promotion within the Teaching Career designed. End target met.

title.narrative: IRI8. School principal evaluation system designed.

actual.value: Software to support the school principal evaluation system designed. End target met.

title.narrative: IRI4. National surveys carried out to evaluate child development progress and the quality of public Preschool Education services.
PDOI3. School management positions staffed through the school principal evaluation system.
IRI2. Additional grades at the Primary Education and Secondary Education levels in which sound national assessments are administered in at least two subject areas.
IRI3. Results of national student assessments in new grades at the Primary Education and Secondary Education levels reported at theregional and school level.
IRI1. Student assessments for new grades of Primary Education and Secondary Education levels validated in a pilot study.
PDOI1. Cycles of Preschool, Primary and Secondary Education levels with student learning outcomes analyzed.
IRI6. National studies of classroom instructional practice in Primary Education and/or Secondary Education levels, as the case may be.
IRI7. Results of national studies of classroom instructional practice reported at the national level.
IRI5. Borrower’s (through MINEDU) participation in international assessments of student learning outcomes.

actual.value: TERCE, PISA and ICCS.End target met.

title.narrative: IRI11. School principals certified in school management.
